Description: Colville's Glory is a beautiful, large tree from Madagascar with large pinnate leaves and very conspicuous cylindrical or cone shaped clusters of bright orange flowers that are bright red in bud. The tree grows to a height of 30-50 ft. Its grape-like clusters of velvety buds, varying from chameleon green to blood orange, are a sight to behold. Leaves a double-compound, very similar to those of Gulmohar. Its genus is named for Sir Charles Colville, a former Governor of Mauritius.
Where: Aurobindo Society, Ulsoor, Bangalore latlong: 12 58 48 N, 77 37 3 E)
Name: Colville's Glory Tree
